1.text: A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah. O God, thou art my God; early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee in a dry and thirsty land, where no water is;

2.text: To see thy power and thy glory, so as I have seen thee in the sanctuary.

3.text: Because thy lovingkindness is better than life, my lips shall praise thee.

4.text: Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.

5.text: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips:

6.text: When I remember thee upon my bed, and meditate on thee in the night watches.

7.text: Because thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.

8.text: My soul followeth hard after thee: thy right hand upholdeth me.

9.text: But those that seek my soul, to destroy it, shall go into the lower parts of the earth.

10.text: They shall fall by the sword: they shall be a portion for foxes.

11.text: But the king shall rejoice in God; every one that sweareth by him shall glory: but the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.
